Material used.Description: The experiment was conducted using HEK293 cells expressing the UCHL1 I205N variant.

Readout description.Result Description: The I205N variant showed a 75% reduction in deubiquitinating activity compared to wild-type.

Biological replicates.Description: Three independent biological replicates were performed.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was tested in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type UCHL1-expressing cells were used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector-transfected cells were used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Student's t-test was used for statistical analysis.

Material used.Description: Protein extracts were prepared from brains of UCHL1 I205N transgenic mice.

Readout description.Result Description: UCHL1 protein levels were reduced by 40% in transgenic mice compared to wild-type controls.

Biological replicates.Description: Five mice per group were analyzed.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type mouse brain extracts were used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: No protein loading buffer was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA was used for statistical analysis.

Material used.Description: Transgenic mice were subjected to behavioral tests including rotarod and olfactory assays.

Readout description.Result Description: UCHL1 I205N mice exhibited 30% reduced motor coordination and 20% impaired olfactory function compared to controls.

Biological replicates.Description: Ten mice per group were tested.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type mice were used as a positive control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Mann-Whitney U test was used for statistical analysis.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Motor coordination ≥ 85% of wild-type; olfactory function ≥ 80% of wild-type

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Motor coordination < 70% of wild-type; olfactory function < 60% of wild-type
